alert.note: Alert for Rosebud; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 16 at 11:18AM MDT until June 18 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River at Forsyth affecting Rosebud and Treasure Counties. .Flood waters continue to move down the Yellowstone River east of Billings where they crested Wednesday night. Minor flooding should be expected along the river affecting Treasure and Rosebud Counties through at least early Saturday morning. Areas that have protective structures along this stretch such as Forsyth may not flood, but other areas will. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is expected for areas that do not have protective structures, and could be serious in some areas. * WHERE...Yellowstone River across Treasure and Rosebud Counties. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 am this morning the stage was at 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.8 feet around midday Friday. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet at Forsyth, but areas unprotected by flood prevention structures will flood at lower levels. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.5 feet on 05/30/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Friday afternoon at 1245 PM MDT.
